A dropdown menu for each capsule in the crew selection tab would do if you can only have one suit type per capsule.

What about a backpack object that can 'dock' with your kerbal, similar to how the seat do now? The backpack would just be a basic EVA jetpack by default but it would have space on it to add other parts, in the VAB. So you could have a backpack with an antenna, or science experiments, or extra fuel or a floodlight. That way, it's up to you what extra capabilities your Kerbal has while on EVA.

Id take this one step farther: different suits for different jobs and environments. a space walk suit, a suit for the mun, a suit for duna etc etc

I can understand not transmitting data since the electric charge requirement is pretty high. But if your kerbal is in a seat and the seat has an antenna the data will transmit (great for rovers).

If nearby ships could act as relay, you wouldn't need much energy to radio in your report. But this is something extra to code, especially with the no-two-active-ships-at-a-time thing going on, which is likely why in this introductory state of the Science feature all VESSELs (which includes EVA kerbals) have this button for now, and only after clicking it is checked whether the necessary resources are actually available: It's not universally pretty, but it works, it is largely bug-free, ship it.
